episodeTitle: Goodbye Drum Island! I'm Going Out to Sea!
episodeTitleJapanese: さようならドラム島！僕は海へ出る！
episodeTitleRomanized: Sayōnara Doramu-tō! Boku wa umi e deru!
description: Chopper officially sets sail with the Straw Hat Pirates as they depart Drum Island, heading toward Arabasta. The crew bonds with their new doctor and learns about the urgency of their mission to stop Crocodile's coup.

events.title: Straw Hats Depart Drum Island
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates sail away from Drum Island aboard the Going Merry with Chopper now officially part of the crew. As they leave, they witness the beautiful cherry blossom effect created by Dr. Kureha's farewell.
events.significance: Marks the conclusion of the Drum Island Arc and Chopper's transition from his homeland to life as a pirate. The cherry blossoms serve as a final tribute to Dr. Hiriluk's legacy.

events.title: Crew Bonds with Chopper
events.description: The Straw Hat crew engages in playful bonding activities with their new member. Luffy entertains everyone with his 'nose chopsticks' trick, and the crew invites Chopper to join in drinking and singing.
events.significance: Establishes Chopper's integration into the crew dynamics and showcases the welcoming, carefree nature of the Straw Hat Pirates.

quotes.text: I've never had this much fun before!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Chopper expressing joy at being part of the crew during their toast

events.title: Chopper Discovers Kureha's Gift
events.description: Chopper worries he left his medical bag behind on Drum Island, but Nami shows him the bag was already packed in his sleigh. Chopper realizes Dr. Kureha anticipated his departure and packed it for him.
events.significance: Reveals Kureha's caring nature beneath her tough exterior and her acceptance of Chopper's decision to leave. Shows the depth of their mentor-student relationship.

events.title: Toast to New Crewmate Chopper
events.description: Usopp proposes a toast to celebrate their new crewmate, officially welcoming Chopper as the Straw Hat Pirates' doctor. Chopper expresses that he's never had this much fun before.
events.significance: Formal acknowledgment and celebration of Chopper joining the crew as their sixth member and ship's doctor.

quotes.text: I've never had this much fun before!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: During the toast celebrating his joining the crew

events.title: Kureha and Dalton's Conversation
events.description: On Drum Island, Dr. Kureha and Dalton reflect on recent events. Kureha reveals that the real miracle of Hiriluk's cherry blossoms was sending Chopper out to sea on his own. Dalton discusses his plans to help reform the kingdom now that Wapol is gone.
events.significance: Provides closure to the Drum Island storyline and establishes Dalton's commitment to rebuilding the kingdom. Reinforces the theme of Chopper's growth and independence.

quotes.text: The real miracle of Hiriluk's cherry blossoms was sending Chopper out on his own.
quotes.speaker: Dr. Kureha
quotes.context: Reflecting on Chopper's departure with Dalton

events.title: Baroque Works Structure Revealed
events.description: Vivi and Nami brief Chopper on the Arabasta situation, explaining Crocodile's plan to take over the kingdom. They reveal that Baroque Works has approximately 2,000 operatives organized in a hierarchical structure, making it a formidable criminal organization.
events.significance: Establishes the scale of the threat facing Arabasta and sets up the challenges the Straw Hats will face. Provides crucial information about the main antagonist organization of the arc.

events.title: Ace's Message to Meet in Arabasta
events.description: The crew receives word that Ace, Luffy's older brother, sent a message asking Luffy to meet him in Arabasta within ten days. This adds urgency to their mission.
events.significance: Foreshadows Ace's appearance in the Arabasta Arc and creates a time limit for the crew's arrival. This is one of the first mentions of Ace to the broader audience.

events.title: Giant Bird Attacks the Going Merry
events.description: A giant bird flies over the Going Merry and swoops down to attack, grabbing Luffy in its beak. The crew is caught off guard by the sudden aerial assault.
events.significance: Introduces an immediate obstacle and provides action in an otherwise dialogue-heavy episode. Sets up Luffy's technique demonstration.

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Propeller Debut
events.description: Luffy grabs the giant bird's beak and uses a new technique called 'Gomu Gomu no Propeller' where he spins the bird around in a cyclone motion before slamming it down onto the Going Merry's deck. He then presents the bird as fresh meat for Sanji.
events.significance: Debuts an anime-original Gomu Gomu technique. Demonstrates Luffy's creative use of his Devil Fruit powers and his constant hunger.

events.title: Mr. 2 Bon Kurei Heads to Arabasta
events.description: Mr. 2 Bon Kurei is shown at Little Garden, punishing his navigator for failing to locate Mr. 3. After failing his mission to assassinate Mr. 3, he decides to redirect his course toward Arabasta.
events.significance: Sets up the eventual confrontation between Mr. 2 and the Straw Hats. Establishes that multiple Baroque Works agents are converging on Arabasta, escalating the threat level.

quotes.text: I've never had this much fun before!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Expressing joy during the toast to celebrate joining the crew

quotes.text: The real miracle of Hiriluk's cherry blossoms was sending Chopper out on his own.
quotes.speaker: Dr. Kureha
quotes.context: Reflecting on Chopper's departure with Dalton

themes.description: The episode focuses on Chopper finding his place among the Straw Hats and experiencing genuine friendship and acceptance for the first time in his life.
themes.symbolism: The cherry blossoms seen in the distance represent both the miracle of Hiriluk's dream and Chopper's transformation from an isolated outcast to a valued crew member.

themes.description: Kureha's preparation of Chopper's medical bag and her reflections on sending him to sea demonstrate the natural progression of a student surpassing their mentor and finding their own path.
themes.symbolism: The packed medical bag represents Kureha's blessing and acknowledgment that Chopper is ready for independence.

themes.description: The episode transitions from the emotional farewell to Drum Island into setting up the urgency of the Arabasta mission, with information about Baroque Works' scale and Ace's time-limited message.

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper experiences the joy of true friendship and belonging as he bonds with his new crewmates. His statement about never having had this much fun shows his emotional growth and acceptance of his decision to leave Drum Island.
keyActions: Reflects on leaving Drum Island while seeing cherry blossoms
Discovers Kureha packed his medical bag
Celebrates officially joining the crew with a toast
quotes: I've never had this much fun before!

characterSpotlights.development: Kureha demonstrates her deep care for Chopper by secretly packing his medical bag and revealing that sending him to sea was the true miracle of Hiriluk's cherry blossoms.
keyActions: Secretly packs Chopper's medical bag before his departure
Reflects with Dalton on Chopper's journey
Reveals the deeper meaning of Hiriluk's legacy
quotes: The real miracle of Hiriluk's cherry blossoms was sending Chopper out on his own.

characterSpotlights.development: Vivi takes charge in explaining the gravity of the Arabasta situation to Chopper, demonstrating her growing role as a strategic member of the group.
keyActions: Conveys the urgency of their mission

mangaDifferences.difference: The Gomu Gomu no Propeller technique used against the giant bird is anime-original and does not appear in the manga.
Episode 91 combines content from multiple manga chapters (142, 154, and 155) and adds original transitional content for pacing.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the final episode of the Drum Island Arc, which began in Episode 78.
The opening 'Believe' by Folder5 spans episodes 48-115, making Episode 91 fall in the middle of this opening's run.
Episode 91 is the last episode to use 'BEFORE DAWN' by Ai-Sachi as the ending theme (episodes 82-94).
Chopper officially becomes the sixth member of the Straw Hat Pirates in the previous episode (90), but Episode 91 shows his first full adventure sailing with the crew.
This episode aired in Japan on December 9, 2001, but didn't air in the United States until September 29, 2009 - nearly 8 years later.
Gomu Gomu no Propeller is an anime-original technique that doesn't appear in the manga, created to add action to this transitional episode.
